intro: Acrochaete, commonly known as the glassworts, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically found in saline or coastal environments, where they thrive in brackish or saltwater conditions. Acrochaete species are characterized by their succulent, often fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers.
